chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Armond D Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge by August 7, 2020.
- Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL TO APPLY. 
- Court ordered Defendant to pay MANDATORY costs, fees (INCLUDING SUPERVISION FEES), and assessments (INCLUDING DOMESTIC ABUSE) by August 7, 2020. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL TO APPLY.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 47 DAYS time served. 
- Huber Release privileges for work.

*Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
*Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armond D Curry

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, PLEAS AND SENTENCING HEARING Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing AUGUST 7, 2019 by HANNAH JAGLER.
Received & Filed,PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing AUGUST 7, 2019 by HANNAH JAGLER.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, Defense counsel, and Defendant. 
Additional Statements by: Kainisha C. and Keyona B. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Court sentenced the Defendant to serve 6 (SIX) MONTHS in the House of Correction, Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 47 DAYS time served. 
Huber Release privileges for work.

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge by August 7, 2020. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL TO APPLY. 

Court ordered Defendant to pay MANDATORY costs, fees (INCLUDING SUPERVISION FEES), and assessments (INCLUDING DOMESTIC ABUSE) by August 7, 2020. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL TO APPLY. 

*Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
*Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
*Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; and PreTrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Armond D Curry in Court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Armond D Curry in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense counsel and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 2 AND COUNT 3: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 AND COUNT 3 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing.

*Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
*Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in Court, Defendant Armond D Curry not in Court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Defendant's appearance waived for first call. Discussion placed on the record. Defense is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE REPORT dated July 3, 2019; received and filed. 
BENCH WARRANT STATUS.

Defendant Armond D Curry in Court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Defense is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar. 

Case re-called. State provided an update to the Court. ADA Ginsberg potentially in trial in Branch 4 and there is no ADA to cover. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial, Branch 46. 
Court reiterated conditions of Bail and No Contact Order. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint.  Jury Trial scheduled for August 7, 2019 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated April 26, 2019; received and filed.

Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/29/19 in Branch 46.  The police officer is still on medical leave and may not be available for trial.  State intends to proceed in with or without the officer.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Pretrial Supervision Services Report-3-21-19, filed.   rmm

Defendant Armond D Curry in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for SPEEDY jury trial. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 46.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 21, 2019 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 29, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for final pre-trial/Final pretrial held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 46 on February 4, 2019 at 8:30 a.m. State rescinded their offer.

18RM125352  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12/08/2018
Deadline: 2/6/2019

Defendant Armond D Curry in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Armond D Curry in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 

Defense enters Speedy Trial Demand. 

Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Motions due by 12/26/2018. Witness Lists and Motions in Limine must be filed by the Final Pretrial date. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2019 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 4, 2019 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Defendant Armond D Curry in court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defense counsel not appointed. Court finds GOOD CAUSE to waive time limits. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in branch 21.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact/Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Antoinette J. and Kai-Nisha C. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Armond D Curry in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Armond D Curry in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty to Counts 1 and 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
